memberdef.name: USYNERGY_REPLY_BUFFER_SIZE
memberdef.initializer: 1024 /* Maximum size of a reply packet */

memberdef.name: USYNERGY_RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
memberdef.initializer: 4096 /* Maximum size of an incoming packet */

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy needs to connect to the host. It doesn't imply a network implementation or destination address, that must all be handled on the user side. The function should return USYNERGY_TRUE if a connection was established or USYNERGY_FALSE if it could not connect.

When network errors occur (e.g. uSynergySend or uSynergyReceive fail) then the connect call will be called again so the implementation of the function must close any old connections and clean up resources before retrying.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context

memberdef.definition: typedef uSynergyBool(* uSynergySendFunc) (uSynergyCookie cookie, const uint8_t *buffer, int length)
memberdef.name: uSynergySendFunc

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy needs to send something over the default connection. It should return USYNERGY_TRUE if sending succeeded and USYNERGY_FALSE otherwise. This function should block until the send operation is completed.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Address of buffer to send
Length of buffer to send

memberdef.definition: typedef uSynergyBool(* uSynergyReceiveFunc) (uSynergyCookie cookie, uint8_t *buffer, int maxLength, int *outLength)
memberdef.name: uSynergyReceiveFunc

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy needs to receive data from the default connection. It should return USYNERGY_TRUE if receiving data succeeded and USYNERGY_FALSE otherwise. This function should block until data has been received and wait for data to become available. If outLength is set to 0 upon completion it is assumed that the connection is alive, but still in a connecting state and needs time to settle.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Address of buffer to receive data into
Maximum amount of bytes to write into the receive buffer
Address of integer that receives the actual amount of bytes written into buffer

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergySleepFunc) (uSynergyCookie cookie, int timeMs)
memberdef.name: uSynergySleepFunc

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy wants to suspend operation for a while before retrying an operation. It is mostly used when a socket times out or disconnect occurs to prevent uSynergy from continuously hammering a network connection in case the network is down.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Time to sleep the current thread (in milliseconds)

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy needs to know the current time. This is used to determine when timeouts have occured. The time base should be a cyclic millisecond time value.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyTraceFunc) (uSynergyCookie cookie, const char *text)
memberdef.name: uSynergyTraceFunc

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when uSynergy wants to trace something. It is optional to show these messages, but they are often useful when debugging. uSynergy only traces major events like connecting and disconnecting. Usually only a single trace is shown when the connection is established and no more trace are called.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Text to be traced

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyScreenActiveCallback) (uSynergyCookie cookie, uSynergyBool active)
memberdef.name: uSynergyScreenActiveCallback

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called when Synergy makes the screen active or inactive. This callback is usually sent when the mouse enters or leaves the screen.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Activation flag, 1 if the screen has become active, 0 if the screen has become inactive

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyMouseCallback) (uSynergyCookie cookie, uint16_t x, uint16_t y, int16_t wheelX, int16_t wheelY, uSynergyBool buttonLeft, uSynergyBool buttonRight, uSynergyBool buttonMiddle)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uSynergyCookie cookie, uint16_t x, uint16_t y, int16_t wheelX, int16_t wheelY, uSynergyBool buttonLeft, uSynergyBool buttonRight, uSynergyBool buttonMiddle)
memberdef.name: uSynergyMouseCallback

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called when a mouse events happens. The mouse X and Y position, wheel and button state is communicated in the message. It's up to the user to interpret if this is a mouse up, down, double-click or other message.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Mouse X position
Mouse Y position
Mouse wheel X position
Mouse wheel Y position
Left button pressed status, 0 for released, 1 for pressed
Middle button pressed status, 0 for released, 1 for pressed
Right button pressed status, 0 for released, 1 for pressed

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyKeyboardCallback) (uSynergyCookie cookie, uint16_t key, uint16_t modifiers, uSynergyBool down, uSynergyBool repeat)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uSynergyCookie cookie, uint16_t key, uint16_t modifiers, uSynergyBool down, uSynergyBool repeat)
memberdef.name: uSynergyKeyboardCallback

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called when a key is pressed or released.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Key code of key that was pressed or released
Status of modifier keys (alt, shift, etc.)
Down or up status, 1 is key is pressed down, 0 if key is released (up)
Repeat flag, 1 if the key is down because the key is repeating, 0 if the key is initially pressed by the user

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyJoystickCallback) (uSynergyCookie cookie, uint8_t joyNum, uint16_t buttons, int8_t leftStickX, int8_t leftStickY, int8_t rightStickX, int8_t rightStickY)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uSynergyCookie cookie, uint8_t joyNum, uint16_t buttons, int8_t leftStickX, int8_t leftStickY, int8_t rightStickX, int8_t rightStickY)
memberdef.name: uSynergyJoystickCallback

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called when a joystick stick or button changes. It is possible that multiple callbacks are fired when different sticks or buttons change as these are individual messages in the packet stream. Each callback will contain all the valid state for the different axes and buttons. The last callback received will represent the most current joystick state.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Joystick number, always in the range [0 ... USYNERGY_NUM_JOYSTICKS>
Button pressed mask
Left stick X position, in range [-127 ... 127]
Left stick Y position, in range [-127 ... 127]
Right stick X position, in range [-127 ... 127]
Right stick Y position, in range [-127 ... 127]

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uSynergyClipboardCallback) (uSynergyCookie cookie, enum uSynergyClipboardFormat format, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t size)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uSynergyCookie cookie, enum uSynergyClipboardFormat format, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t size)
memberdef.name: uSynergyClipboardCallback

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called when something is placed on the clipboard. Multiple callbacks may be fired for multiple clipboard formats if they are supported. The data provided is read-only and may not be modified by the application.

parameterdescription.para: Cookie supplied in the Synergy context
Clipboard format
Memory area containing the clipboard raw data
Size of clipboard data

detaileddescription.para: This function initializes context for use. Call this function directly after creating the context, before filling in any configuration data in it. Not calling this function will cause undefined behavior.

parameterdescription.para: Context to be initialized

detaileddescription.para: This function updates uSynergy and does the bulk of the work. It does connection management, receiving data, reconnecting after errors or timeouts and so on. It assumes that networking operations are blocking and it can suspend the current thread if it needs to wait. It is best practice to call uSynergyUpdate from a background thread so it is responsive.
Because uSynergy relies mostly on blocking calls it will mostly stay in thread sleep state waiting for system mutexes and won't eat much memory.
uSynergyUpdate doesn't do any memory allocations or have any side effects beyond those of the callbacks it calls.

parameterdescription.para: Context to be updated

detaileddescription.para: This function sets new clipboard data and sends it to the server. Use this function if your client cuts or copies data onto the clipboard that it needs to share with the server.
Currently there is only support for plaintext, but HTML and image data could be supported with some effort.

parameterdescription.para: Context to send clipboard data to
Text to set to the clipboard
